intro: Cryptotaenia calycina, commonly known as the Japanese cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, hollow stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Cryptotaenia calycina is often grown as an ornamental plant for its delicate appearance and fragrance.
